The fee structure depends on your chosen program. For B.Tech, the tuition fee is approximately ₹1,20,000 per year. MBA is around ₹1,80,000 per year, while Law programs cost about ₹1,00,000 per year. Hostel charges range between ₹80,000–₹1,00,000 annually. Additional charges may apply for mess, transport, or special facilities. Vel Tech also offers installment facilities and scholarships to reduce financial burden.

Vel Tech provides separate hostels for boys and girls with 24/7 security. Rooms are mostly shared, with options for 2–4 students per room. Facilities include Wi-Fi, mess, laundry, and study halls. Hostel fee is around ₹80,000–₹1,00,000 per year. Curfew timings are followed for safety, and parents can visit with permission. Cooking inside hostels is not allowed.

Vel Tech has a strong placement cell that connects students with top companies. Over 70–80% of eligible students get placed every year. CSE and IT students often receive offers from MNCs like Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Amazon, and Accenture. Core companies also visit for Mechanical, Civil, and ECE. The average salary package is around 4–5 LPA, with top offers going up to 12–15 LPA. Internship and training support is also provided.

The average salary package is around 4–5 LPA, with top offers going up to 12–15 LPA. Internship and training support is also provided.

Vel Tech offers a variety of scholarships based on academic merit, entrance exam performance, sports, and category. Through the Vel Tech Entrance Exam (VTUEEE), students can get scholarships up to 75% of the tuition fee depending on their rank. Government scholarships and community-based concessions are also accepted. Special scholarships are available for girls, economically weaker sections, and meritorious students. You can apply during admission by submitting required documents.

Exams at Vel Tech are conducted semester-wise, with both internal assessments and final exams. Each subject usually has 2–3 internal tests, assignments, and lab work contributing to internal marks. The final semester exam carries major weightage. Evaluation is based on credit and grade point system. Passing requires minimum marks in both internals and finals. Revaluation and arrear exams are available if required.

Vel Tech provides multiple messes and canteens with both vegetarian and non-vegetarian food. North Indian and South Indian meals are available, including options for Jain food. The MBA program at Vel Tech is a two-year course offering specializations in Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Operations, and Business Analytics. Eligibility requires a bachelor’s degree with minimum 50% marks. Admissions are based on CAT/MAT/XAT/CMAT/TANCET scores. The program includes internships, case studies, and industry projects with good placement opportunities in reputed companies.

Vel Tech offers undergraduate and postgraduate Law programs including BA LLB and LLM. Eligibility requires 10+2 for UG and a bachelor’s degree for PG. Graduates can pursue careers in advocacy, corporate law, or judiciary exams.
